reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the last night of a short break in France. The reception staff were very friendly and informative. The bedroom was large with a small balcony. For dinner we had the set menu which was ok. Breakfast was buffet style with a reasonable choice. A bonus point was the coffee was Nepresso!
reviews.title: Comfortable
Family Stay
reviews.text: Overall we found the hotel was a little 'tired' and in need of refurbishment. They were expecting a large party in the day we left and we feel that this is their market catchment area. We would stay there again if no other choices were available!

We stayed in this hotel as a family ( 7 and 3 year old children ) in June 2012. The is a 20 minute walk or 5 minute drive from the old town and is conveniently located one block back from the seafront. We enjoyed walking along the promenade ( it's possible to walk right to the old town this way) and the kids enjoyed the beach which was sandy and gently sloping. The hotel has two family rooms (room 100 was ours and it was very spacious - a separate bedroom with two singles for the kids). Reception staff were excellent - friendly and informative. On one occasion we were recommended to visit a local village not originally on our to-do list and it was stunning (Saint-Suliac).
reviews.title: A luxurious Respite Outside the Walled City

reviews.text: The hotel has a great indoor swimming pool which the kids enjoyed - it was always quiet (well, until they arrived of course) and also a pool table in the lobby (1 euro per game ). Parking was plentiful ever in the hotels small open-air carppark or on the street immediately outside the hotel, which we found to be safe and convenient.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel in St Malo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed buffet breakfast in the hotel but ate lunch and dinner out. The are 5-6 decent affordable restaurants within 10 minutes walk towards the old town (Tavern de Commerce and a good Pizzeria next door to this ) and in the old town itself plenty of eating places.
reviews.title: NOISY BUILDING WORK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after 6pm one Wednesday in early September, after the end of the high season period and were able to obtain a significant reduction in the room rate from the polite and knowledgeable receptionist. He made great play of selecting us the best available room and personally escorting us to and showing us the room. The room was spacious, modern, clean and well equipped and allowed us a quiet night's sleep.
reviews.title: Comfortable traditional hotel just back from the plage du Sillon.

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is only 100 metres back from the sea front and the magnificent sandy beach and within easy walking distance of St Malo's harbour and delightful old walled town.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The typical French buffet breakfast was excellent and plentiful, served in a pleasant breakfast room. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, preferring to dine at one of the great selection of restaurants in the walled town.
reviews.title: We like

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We found the service to be excellent, all the staff very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect, really close to the beach. Swimming pool is great in raining days (covered). We had a fantastic time, nice walk along the beach to reach the intra-murs city. I would definately recommend this hotel, managers and staff are so welcoming and love having children around (even in the restaurant) !!
reviews.title: Expensive and not suitable for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big problem at check in; the computer had lost our booking. Whether the hotel or the booking agency's (not Tripadvisor) equipment was at fault was unclear. But they sorted it promptly even though the four of us had to share one room for the first night. A longish walk from the old city but we liked our eventual rooms (big bright and clean) and our teenagers liked the pool and pool table. Restaurant was only average and not cheap but breakfast was good. Helpful (and in one case) most glamorous staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Delayed by bad weather and traffic in paris, we arrived very late to Saint-Malo. Staff was super helpful even at a late hour. Hotel is a little tricky to find in the dark, but well worth it. Staff is cheerful and knowledgeable and hospitable. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed, especially good for a family.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, good location and facilities

reviews.text: I come 2/3 times/year in Saint Malo for 10 years, and each time I stay at the hotel of courtoisville.
reviews.title: JUST FANTASTIC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been desapointed by the quality of the service, by the room, by the dinner. All is perfect.
reviews.title: Smart hotel with nice indoor pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a fantastic place to stay, for business or tourism. I hope to come back for next 10 years.
reviews.title: nice hotel conveniently situated

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a week-long break in Brittany. On arrival, we were slightly disappointed that the advertised car park was only available on a first-come, first-served basis and was full. However, this wasn't a problem as there is plenty of parking space on the surrounding roads and security doesn't seem to be an issue.
reviews.title: This was our first hotel stay in France...
